general_advisory: For one-acre area of paddy transplanting 400 m2 (10 Decimal) size of land is required for nursery raising. Before sowing, paddy seeds should be treated with Trichoderma powder formulation@10g/kg of seeds or any other seed treating chemicals like Thiram 75% @ 3 gm or Captan 50% @ 3 gm per kg of seeds procured from the Government approved agencies. Go for non-paddy crops in the upland to avoid terminal drought. Intercropping of cereals+pulses/oilseeds is recommended. Go for early sowing/transplanting as for as possible to complete these by mid-August. Go for medium duration rice varieties in medium land. Go for line sowing of rice followed by early beaushaning and weeding. This will avoid the rainfall required for transplanting, and over -aged seedlings if transplanted late.

advisory: In assured irrigated areas select the land for wet bed nursery close to source of irrigation water with good drainage facilities. It is advisable to follow community nursery approach at village level.

Upland rice varieties like Khandagiri, Sahabhagi Dhan, DRR-42, DRR-44, DRR-46, Mandakini, Naveen, GB-1, Bina-1 1, MTU-1010, Satyabhama etc. can be cultivated. Medium land rice varieties like MTU 1 156, MTU 1 153, CR Dhan 310, RGL 2538, Lalat, Improved Lalat, Manaswini, MTU-1001, Sampada, Gitanjali, Nua acharmati etc can be cultivated. Low land rice varieties like Pratikshya, Swarna, Swarna Sub-1, RGL-2537, MTU-1075, Mrinalini, Hashanta, Rani Dhan, CR 1009, CR 1009 Sub-1, DRR 50, Pooja, MTU-1064, CR-1018, Sarala, Durga, Pradhan Dhan, Nua Kalajeera, Nua chinikamini, CR Sungadhi Dhan-907 etc can be cultivated.

In groundnut, apply well powdered Gypsum @ 100 kg/acre and incorporate into the soil along with the basal fertilizers, this will improve number of pods and pod filling. If pre-emergence herbicide is not applied during sowing than to manage weeds in Groundnut crop post emergence application of herbicide like Imazethapyr 10 % SL @ 300 ml/acre or Quizalofop-Ethyl 5 % EC @ 400 ml/acre should be applied at 15-DAS by mixing it in 200 litre of water. For better peg formation in groundnut crop hoeing and earthing up should be done at 20-25 DAS.
Seed rate for maize is 6-7kg/acre. To avoid the infestation of Fall Army Worm, treat 1-kg seeds with 4-ml Cyantraniliprole19.8%+ Thiamethoxam 19.8% FS. Keep row to row spacing at 60 cm and...

Some improved varieties of Arhar are PRG-235, PRG 176, VL ARHAR-1, T-Arhar etc. For line sowing the recommended seed rate for early maturing varieties is 8 kg whereas for late maturing varieties it is 6 kg...

The seed rate for HYV okra is 4 -kg/acre whereas for hybrid the seed rate is 1.5 kg/acre. For providing resistance against infestation of sucking pests at early stage of crop, treat the seed with imidacloprid.

For cultivation of an acre of brinjal crop 200g of improved variety and 80g of hybrid seed is required. Some important varieties of Brinjal are Utkal tarini, Utkal Madhuri, Safed moti, VNR Long Purple, Akshita, VNR B5, Vairabi, Borigumma round etc...

By using sand over the floor we can keep the floor dry so that the animals are kept free from different diseases. The specialty of this shed is the floor is made of bricks and cement and sand from river is spread over it...

Carp such as Rohu, Catla and Mrigal, which grow rapidly, should be stocked in a certain ratio of 4:3:3 to increase the benefits. Generally, a density of 5,000 fingerlings/ha is kept as a standard stocking. Groundnut...
